title: Ticket #2155: DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION = NEVER, change notifications default
description:
Currently the default for notifications is "notification=complete". As the number of jobs submitted increases, this is increasingly the wrong default answer, leading to users drowning in email if they forget to disable it.

Proposed:

  1. Add DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION to the configuration file. It should default to "never" or perhaps "error"
  2. condor_submit should use DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION as the default value when notification= isn't specified instead of the current hard-wired option of "complete".
  3. Document the setting change in the release notes, noting that an administrator can set "DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION=complete" to restore the old behavior.
remarks:
This was raised again in FW meeting on 5 November 2012.
